required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Upper Extremity Isokinetic Strengthening in Post-stroke Hemiplegia
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Upper Extremity Isokinetic Strengthening in Post-stroke Hemiplegia

brief_summary.textblock: This randomised controlled study will investigate the effectiveness of isokinetic strengthening on the upper extremity functionality and strength in post-stroke hemiplegic patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 4, 8 weeks (change from baseline upper extremity strength at 4 weeks and at 8 weeks will be assessed)
primary_outcome.description: Muscles: forearm flexors and extensors Measurement tool: MicroFET3 (Hoggan Health Industries Inc. West Jordan, UT, USA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 4, 8 weeks (change from baseline pik torque at 4 weeks and at 8 weeks will be assessed)
primary_outcome.description: Muscles: wrist flexors and extensors Measurement Tool: CSMI Humac Norm Cybex isokinetic dinamometer (HUMAC® /2009 Version: 10.000.0065, Computer Sports Medicine Inc., USA)

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement tool: Jamar Hydraulic Hand Dynamometer (Patterson Medical, Warrenville, IL, USA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fugl-Meyer Assessment scale for upper extremity
secondary_outcome.description: Scale range: 0-66; higher values represent a better outcome; subscales are combined by summing to compute a total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Disabilities of the arm, shoulder and hand questionnaire (Part 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Scale range: 0-100; higher scores represent more disabilities of the upper limb; Total score (sum of the scores for 30 questions) is put in a formula to compute the DASH disability score
Includes 8 domains and an extra assessment for stroke recovery; scores range 0-100 for each domain; higher scores represent better outcome; a formula is used for scoring each domain.

intervention.description: isokinetic upper extremity (forearm) strengthening for 4 weeks 3d/w
upper extremity (forearm) strengthening with exercise band 4 weeks 3d/w

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Active motion in upper extremity
- Brunnstrom's Scale above 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable medical conditions
- Cognitive problems
